subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] FM
author: Frank Sumption
full_text:
Thanks. Mostly what I want to know is if I'm just hearing broadcast frags,
or if anyone hears something similar to what I get. Kinda like additional
testing.

 F-S

On Fri, Oct 1, 2010 at 10:45 AM, Snowfire Lioness <SnowfireL@...> wrote:

>
>
>
> Hear all yours frank, loud and clear, just don't have time to write down
> all they are saying though, they are regular little chatter boxes over there
> at your house Frank. sf
>
> -----Original Message-----
> From: Frank Sumption <purplealiengirl@...>
> To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com; RTSC@yahoogroups.com
> Sent: Fri, Oct 1, 2010 2:32 am
> Subject: [EVP-ITC] FM [1 Attachment]
>
>
>  [Attachment(s)<https://mail.google.com/mail/?ui=2&view=js&name=main,tlist&ver=PLpFW8mo6ZU.en.&am=!Y-v-bx6-hLCxhZ4C2vD2RvIM-1u6I_hAKFI_CVzYW09PTIsUQC10&fri#12b68afe7029e8aa_TopText>from Frank Sumption included below]
>    Less than a minute of FM, you can hear more feedback in this--feedback
> is from being in echo chamber mode. At 3 seconds "box---big box',
> 15--seconds "Hultay gets---something", at about 23 seconds a weird one "the
> end comes in hours--you leave the planet", like I haven't heard that about a
> thousand times.
>
>  I found if I lift the top panel up I kills the feedback, so I drilled some
> 3/8 vent holes in the sides that helped quite a bit.
>
>  These aren't Jack approved EVPs, so probably not real, since they are not
> in digital format--except conversion to mp3 for e-mailing. This recording
> started out braodcast out of the radio station analog, traveled to the radio
> in analog RF, was down converted in the radio chip in analog circuits, and
> the audio was recorded on magnetic tape. The EVPs are clearer from tape,
> that's why I use it, cuz digital sucks! I'd use tubes if it wasn't for the
> high voltage power supplies and larger transformers. Some worship this high
> tech crap, which is killing the planet. They over estimate it's true value.
>
>  F-S
>
> 
>

 F-S
